payload.name: theory-of-mind
payload.core: Infer beliefs, intentions, and knowledge states of others, including nested beliefs (what they think you think). Core question: What do they believe, want, and know?

out.valid: goals inferred from evidence not projection
distinguishes known vs believed vs assumed

proc: identify target agents and their roles
infer second-order beliefs (what they think you believe)
map intentions and goals from evidence
check: model based on evidence not projection

diff.game-theoretic: game theory derives actions from optimization; ToM infers beliefs that drive behavior
diff.negotiation: negotiation applies ToM; ToM is the underlying inference engine
diff.rhetorical: rhetoric persuades based on audience model; ToM builds that model
diff.adversarial: adversarial assumes hostile intent; ToM infers actual intent
diff.causal-inference: causal explains events; ToM explains agent behavior via mental states

fail.mode: mind-reading with overconfidence; projecting own incentives onto others
signals: assuming shared knowledge that isn't shared

ex.problem: Team lead notices engineer pushing back on new process
ex.first_order: engineer believes process adds overhead without value
ex.second_order: engineer thinks lead doesn't understand their workload
ex.prediction: resistance will increase if mandated without discussion
ex.strategy: acknowledge workload, explain why process helps, co-design lighter version
